senses.de: A list of topics or tasks that need to be done or talked about, typically for a meeting.
senses.ex: He wanted to discuss his new business ideas in the next meeting so he added it to the agenda.

Tips.title: Meeting Context
Tips.description: Use 'agenda' for the items to be discussed in formal gatherings, such as business or committee meetings.
Tips.example: Your point will be fifth on tomorrow's meeting agenda.

Tips.title: Preparation Importance
Tips.description: Knowing the agenda in advance can help participants prepare for the discussions.
Tips.example: Please review the agenda prior to the conference call.

Tips.title: Action Item
Tips.description: Agendas often end with 'action items' or tasks that need to be completed after the meeting.
Tips.example: The meeting agenda included several action items for the team.

senses.de: A secret objective or set of objectives either personal or collectively agreed upon by a group.
senses.ex: Many people believe that the destruction of the old building was not an accident, but part of a larger agenda.

Tips.title: Concealed Motives
Tips.description: 'Agenda' suggests a plan or motive that is not revealed openly, often with a negative connotation.
Tips.example: He seems helpful, but I suspect he has his own agenda.

Tips.title: Political Use
Tips.description: In politics or business, 'agenda' often refers to a group's goals that might be hidden from the public.
Tips.example: The candidate was accused of having a hidden agenda.

Tips.title: Figurative Meaning
Tips.description: Use 'agenda' figuratively to imply that someone's actions are driven by personal goals.
Tips.example: Despite her friendly facade, she had a competitive agenda.

Calendar.wordDefinition:
A calendar is a tool used to track dates and events over a period of time, such as days, weeks, or months.

An agenda is a list of tasks or plans for a specific meeting or event, while a calendar is a tool used to organize and keep track of dates and events over a period of time.

Itinerary.wordDefinition:
An itinerary is a schedule of planned activities, events, or places to be visited during a trip or vacation. It provides a detailed plan of when and where each activity will take place and allows travelers to plan their time and make the most of their trip.

An agenda is applicable to meetings or events where a plan of discussion is needed, while an itinerary is applicable to trips or vacations that require planning and scheduling of activities.

List.wordDefinition:
List is a collection of items or things that are enumerated or written down.

It can be used to organize tasks or make a record of things that need to be done or purchased. For example, a grocery list may include items such as eggs, bread, and milk.

Agenda is usually used in the context of meetings or events while list is a general term that can be used for various purposes such as organizing, keeping track, or reminding oneself of things to do or items to purchase.

Menu.wordDefinition:
Menu refers to a list of available dishes or food items to be ordered in a restaurant or food establishment.

Agenda is related to discussing topics, while menu is related to ordering food.

Plan.wordDefinition:
A plan is a detailed strategy for achieving a particular goal.

It's a set of steps or actions that need to be taken to make something happen. You might create a plan for launching a startup, achieving a fitness goal, or renovating your home.

So, agendas are typically used for organizing meetings or events, while plans are used for organizing projects or achieving goals.

Programme.wordDefinition:
A program is a plan of action or a list of events that will take place during an event.

It is used to inform attendees about what will be happening and when. For example, a music festival may have a program that includes the names of the bands performing, the times they will perform, and any other activities or events happening at the festival.

Overall, while both agenda and program have overlap in their functionality, the former tends to focus on the topics discussed in a meeting while the latter refers more broadly to the events that will take place during an event.

Schedule.wordDefinition:
Schedule refers to a timeline of events or appointments that have been planned, with specific times and dates. It is a more structured plan than an agenda.

An agenda is a list of things that need to be talked about, while a schedule is a planned timeline of events. An agenda is applicable in meetings or personal planning, while a schedule is applicable in events or appointments.

Timetable.wordDefinition:
Timetable is a schedule of events or activities with specific times allotted for each one. It is commonly used in a school or transportation setting.

An agenda is used for outlining topics that need to be covered or discussed, while a timetable is used for scheduling events or activities with specific times.

quotes.Text: Being raised in a developing country opened my eyes to so much I cannot tolerate. In Colombia, education is sometimes considered a luxury, not a human right. And it's not a priority in the agendas of many leaders.
quotes.Title: Musician
quotes.Name: Shakira

quotes.Text: I'm not afraid of having an agenda. I do have an agenda. It's a positive agenda.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.Text: I will promote a positive agenda focused on issues important to Mississippians.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Cindy Hyde-Smith

quotes.Text: I have helped shape in the past the Democratic Party's agenda on innovation.

quotes.Name: Ro Khanna

quotes.Text: How does he support Clinton's urban agenda? He doesn't know what it is.

quotes.Name: Maxine Waters

quotes.Text: I feel like I'm a nice character, and I don't have my own agenda.

quotes.Text: It's important to push the agenda of hiring women directors.

quotes.Text: I do think there's a lot more we can do on the life agenda.

quotes.Text: As governor, I learned the importance of having an agenda.

quotes.Text: My agenda is trying to help people live a better life.
